meanings.definition: Extremely large or great in size or scale.
meanings.sent1: The elephant was colossally big compared to the mouse.
meanings.sent2: The mountain was colossally tall, reaching up to the sky.
meanings.sent3: The colossally huge cake towered over the tiny cupcakes.
meanings.sent4: The colossally heavy boulder seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent5: The colossally massive ship dominated the harbor with its size.

meanings.definition: To a very great extent or degree.
meanings.sent1: She was colossally happy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent2: The team worked colossally hard to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: He ate colossally quickly, finishing his meal in record time.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was a colossally fun event for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged colossally, causing widespread damage in the city.
